page.title: 08OTTER HOLE CAVES,THE SYSTEM
page.content: Otter hole is the biggest cave under St. Arvans and part of Chepstow.3200m has been discovered.The thing that makes Otter Hole distinctive from any other caving system in the world is the tidal mud washed in at high tide by the River Wye, and spread through out the entrance to the cave system.Also some amazing formations of stalagtites and stalagmites have been found in the caves such as in the "Hall of 30" and the"Straw chamber". The Straw Chamber got its name from the many stalagtites in the chamber each one hollow like a straw. Otter Hole got its name from an old otter breeding place that was in the original entrance.
